alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 9:29PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cleveland and southwestern McClain Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 928 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Washington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Norman, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Lexington, Goldsby, Wayne, Washington, Cole, Etowah, Lake Thunderbird, Criner, Little Axe, and Payne. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 85 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
